alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Madera (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 12 at 6:31PM PDT until March 12 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Fresno County in central California... South Central Madera County in central California... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 631 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fresno, Kerman, Raisin City, Easton, Biola and Calwa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
